intro: Omphalea axillaris, commonly known as the axillary omphalea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, alternate leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Omphalea axillaris is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
